identity.name: PathFinder
identity.visual_mood: Electric Serenity - Calm backgrounds with vibrant, electric accents to signal potential and energy.

headings.usage: Use for all H1-H3. It provides a unique, slightly 'tech-forward' but human feel.

body.usage: Use for all body text, UI elements, and questions. Highly readable.

typography.install_instructions: Add @fontsource/clash-display and @fontsource/manrope via yarn or import from Google Fonts/CDN if available. If Clash Display is hard to source, use 'Space Grotesk' as fallback.

primary.description: Electric Indigo. Use for Primary Buttons, Active States, and Brand Accents.

secondary.description: Vibrant Teal. Use for Progress bars, Success states, and 'Growth' metaphors.

elements: Image: Student with Robotics (masked in organic shape or rounded-3xl)

landing_page.features: Grid-3. Cards with large icons and hover-lift effect.

assessment_flow.progress_bar: Fixed at top or just below nav. Height 8px, rounded-full. Smooth transition.
assessment_flow.likert_scale: Custom Radio Group. 5 circles ranging from small (Disagree) to large (Agree), or color graded from Red (Disagree) to Green/Teal (Agree).

buttons.primary: rounded-full px-8 py-4 font-semibold shadow-lg shadow-indigo-500/30 transition-all hover:scale-105 active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: rounded-full px-6 py-3 bg-white text-indigo-600 border border-indigo-100 hover:bg-indigo-50

cards.base: bg-white border border-slate-100 rounded-2xl shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow duration-300

inputs.style: bg-slate-50 border-transparent focus:bg-white focus:border-indigo-500 rounded-xl h-12 px-4

visual_enhancers.texture: Use subtle noise overlay on the background to reduce 'digital' flatness.
visual_enhancers.shapes: Use floating 'orbs' or 'blobs' with blur-3xl in the background (indigo/teal) to create depth without clutter.
visual_enhancers.icons: Use Lucide-React. Thin strokes (1.5px). Rounded ends.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALLATION: Install 'framer-motion' for animations, 'lucide-react' for icons, and '@radix-ui/react-*' primitives if needed.
2. ROUTING: Use React Router. / (Home), /assessment (The flow), /results (The outcome).
3. STATE: Use a global store (Zustand or Context) to persist answers across the 4 pages of the assessment.
4. NO AUTH: Do not build login screens. The user starts immediately.
5. DATA: Mock the career algorithm. Based on Likert sums, map to 4-5 archetypes (e.g., 'The Innovator', 'The Helper', 'The Analyst').
6. LIKERT SCALES: Do not use standard radio buttons. Create big, clickable targets. Maybe emojis or changing size circles.
7. PROGRESS: Show a sticky progress bar. It must encourage completion (e.g., 'You're halfway to your future!').

dont_s: Do not use default Shadcn cards without customizing radius (use rounded-2xl+).
Do not make the assessment feel like a tax form. It must be a 'Journey'.
Do not use dark gradients for this student app. Keep it light and airy.
dos: Ensure mobile responsiveness. The assessment must be thumb-friendly.
Use z-index to layer elements (background blobs < content).
